message.content: {"id": "3622", "title": "Bug 3622 - New Package Wizard has confusing message", "description": "Bug 3622 - New Package Wizard has a confusing message", "OB": "When invoking the 'New Java Package' wizard, before entering any text, a message appears at the top saying 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists'. This message is unclear and does not provide any guidance. It is not clear if this is an error or a warning. The package name field is currently empty. It is suggested that if this is an error, it should be displayed in red with an error icon. Additionally, there should be no error message displayed when the package name field is empty and the 'Finish' button should be disabled.", "EB": "The message should be revised to provide clearer instructions and guidance, stating that the package name entered should be unique and not match any existing folders. If an error occurs, it should be displayed in red with an error icon. Additionally, the error message should not be displayed when the package name field is empty and the 'Finish' button should be disabled.", "SR": "To reproduce the issue: 1. Create a new Java Project. 2. Select the project. 3. " }

origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '3622', 'title': 'Bug 3622New Package Wizard has confusing message (1GD0L9O)', 'description': 'Bug 3622New Package Wizard has confusing message (1GD0L9O) ', 'OB': 'Invoke New Java Package.Result: Before you type anything the following message appears at the top: "A foldercorresponding to the package name already exists".At this point my package name fieldis empty.What does this message mean?Is this an error?If so, should it be displayed inred with the error icon?NOTES:EG (5/1/2001 5:53:41 AM)there should be no error message when the package name field is empty andfinish should be disabled.MA (5/2/01 9:34:00 AM)It is a warning.I will remove the messageEG (5/2/01 9:43:44 AM)issue how to create a default package?It can\'t be created by the user since it always there. ', 'EB': '', 'SR': 'Create a new Java Project2. Select the project.3. '}
